1.text: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

2.text: Therefore when thou doest [thine] alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

3.text: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

4.text: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

5.text: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites [are]: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

6.text: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

7.text: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen [do]: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

8.text: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

9.text: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

10.text: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as [it is] in heaven.

11.text: Give us this day our daily bread.

12.text: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

13.text: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.

14.text: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

15.text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

16.text: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

17.text: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;

18.text: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.

19.text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:

20.text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

21.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

22.text: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

23.text: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great [is] that darkness!

24.text: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

25.text: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?

26.text: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?

27.text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

28.text: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

29.text: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

30.text: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, [shall he] not much more [clothe] you, O ye of little faith?

31.text: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

32.text: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

33.text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

34.text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day [is] the evil thereof.
